section_id: ## 4. Main Result: Ricci Tensor as Metric Functional

hints.label: thm-ricci-metric-functional-rigorous
hints.title: Ricci Tensor Depends Only on Metric (Rigorous)
hints.content:
517: :label: thm-ricci-metric-functional-rigorous
518: 
519: The Ricci tensor derived from scutoid plaquettes depends on the walker measure $\mu_t(x, v)$ **only through** the emergent metric $g_{\mu\nu}[\mu_t]$:
520: 
521: $$
522: R_{\mu\nu}^{\text{scutoid}}[\mu_t] = R_{\mu\nu}[g[\mu_t], \partial g, \partial^2 g] + O(N^{-2/d})
523: $$
524: 
525: where:
526: - $g_{ij}[\mu_t](x) = H_{ij}[\mu_t](x) + \varepsilon \delta_{ij}$ is the emergent metric from expected Hessian (Chapter 8)
527: - $R_{\mu\nu}[g, \partial g, \partial^2 g]$ is the **Riemannian Ricci tensor** computed from $g$ and its derivatives
528: 
529: **Consequently**, for the purpose of Lovelock's theorem ({prf:ref}`thm-lovelock-uniqueness`), the scutoid Ricci tensor satisfies the required property:
530: 
531: $$
532: R_{\mu\nu} = R_{\mu\nu}[g_{\alpha\beta}]
533: $$
534: 
535: **Proof**:
536: 
537: This follows by combining the three main results:
538: 
539: 1. **CVT encodes optimal transport metric** ({prf:ref}`prop-cvt-encodes-metric`):
540:    $$
541:    g_{ij}^{\text{CVT}}[\rho_t] = g_{ij}^{\text{OT}}[\rho_t] + O(N^{-1/d})
542:    $$
543: 
544: 2. **Emergent metric = OT metric** ({prf:ref}`lem-emergent-equals-ot`):
545:    $$
546:    g_{ij}^{\text{emergent}}[\mu_t] = g_{ij}^{\text{OT}}[\rho_t] + \varepsilon \delta_{ij} + O(N^{-1/d})
547:    $$
548:    where $\rho_t(x) = \int \mu_t(x, v) dv$ is the spatial density.
549: 
550: 3. **Scutoid Ricci converges to Riemannian Ricci** ({prf:ref}`thm-scutoid-ricci-convergence`):
551:    $$
552:    R_{\mu\nu}^{\text{scutoid}}[\rho_t] = R_{\mu\nu}[g^{\text{CVT}}[\rho_t]] + O(N^{-2/d})
553:    $$
554: 
555: Combining (1) + (2):
556: 
557: $$
558: g^{\text{emergent}}[\mu_t] = g^{\text{CVT}}[\rho_t] + O(N^{-1/d})
559: $$
560: 
561: Therefore, by (3):
562: 
563: $$
564: R_{\mu\nu}^{\text{scutoid}}[\mu_t] = R_{\mu\nu}[g^{\text{emergent}}[\mu_t]] + O(N^{-2/d})
565: $$
566: 
567: Since the Ricci tensor $R_{\mu\nu}[g]$ is a function of $g$ and its derivatives (via Christoffel symbols), we have:
568: 
569: $$
570: \boxed{R_{\mu\nu}^{\text{scutoid}}[\mu_t] = R_{\mu\nu}[g[\mu_t], \partial g, \partial^2 g] + O(N^{-2/d})}
571: $$
572: 
573: **Crucially**, the dependence on $\mu_t$ factors through:
574: 
575: $$
576: \mu_t \xrightarrow{\text{marginal}} \rho_t = \int \mu_t dv \xrightarrow{\text{OT/CVT}} g[\rho_t] \xrightarrow{\text{Regge}} R_{\mu\nu}[g]
577: $$
578: 
579: There is **no additional dependence** on the velocity distribution or higher-order moments of $\mu_t$—only on the spatial density $\rho_t$, and then only through the metric $g[\rho_t]$.
580:
